treatments.title: conditions and treatments
treatments.content: get back to doing what you love faster

conditions.name: Accessory Navicular Syndrome
conditions.description: The accessory navicular (os navicularum or os tibiale externum) is an extra bone or piece of cartilage located on the inner side of the foot just above the arch.

conditions.name: Achilles & Plantar Fascia Stretches
conditions.description: Stretching exercise to help you out

conditions.name: Achilles Tendon Disorders
conditions.description: Achilles tendonitis is an inflammation of the Achilles tendon. Over time, if not resolved, the condition may progress to a degeneration of the tendon (Achilles tendonosis), in which the tendon loses its organized structure and is likely to develop microscopic tears.

conditions.name: Ankle Fractures
conditions.description: A fracture is a partial or complete break in a bone. Fractures in the ankle can range from the less serious avulsion injuries (small pieces of bone that have been pulled off) to severe shattering-type breaks of the tibia, fibula or both.

conditions.name: Ankle Sprain
conditions.description: An ankle sprain is an injury to one or more ligaments in the ankle, usually on the outside of the ankle. Ligaments are bands of tissue—like rubber bands—that connect one bone to another and bind the joints together.

conditions.name: Bunions
conditions.description: A bunion (also referred to as hallux valgus) is often described as a bump on the side of the big toe. But a bunion is more than that. The visible bump actually reflects changes in the bony framework of the front part of the foot.

conditions.name: Chronic Ankle Instability
conditions.description: Chronic ankle instability is a condition characterized by a recurring giving way of the outer (lateral) side of the ankle. This condition often develops after repeated ankle sprains.

conditions.name: Diabetic Complications & Amputation Prevention
conditions.description: People living with diabetes are prone to having foot problems, often because of two complications of diabetes: nerve damage (neuropathy) and poor circulation.

conditions.name: Diabetic Foot Care
conditions.description: Diabetes can be dangerous to your feet—even a small cut can produce serious consequences. Diabetes may cause nerve damage that takes away the feeling in your feet.

conditions.name: Ganglion Cyst
conditions.description: A ganglion cyst is a sac filled with a jellylike fluid that originates from a tendon sheath or joint capsule. The word “ganglion” means knot and is used to describe the knot-like mass or lump that forms below the surface of the skin.

conditions.name: Gout
conditions.description: Gout is a disorder that results from the buildup of uric acid in the tissues or a joint. It most often affects the joint of the big toe.

conditions.name: Hallux Rigidus/Limitus
conditions.description: Hallux rigidus is a disorder of the joint located at the base of the big toe. It causes pain and stiffness in the joint, and with time, it gets increasingly harder to bend the toe.

conditions.name: Hammertoe
conditions.description: Hammertoe is a contracture (bending) deformity of one or both joints of the second, third, fourth or fifth (little) toes. This abnormal bending can put pressure on the toe when wearing shoes, causing problems to develop.

conditions.name: Ingrown Toenails
conditions.description: When a toenail is ingrown, it is curved and grows into the skin, usually at the nail borders (the sides of the nail). This digging in of the nail irritates the skin, often creating pain, redness, swelling and warmth in the toe.

conditions.name: Morton's Neuroma
conditions.description: A neuroma is a thickening of nerve tissue that may develop in various parts of the body. The most common neuroma in the foot is a Morton’s neuroma, which occurs between the third and fourth toes. It is sometimes referred to as an intermetatarsal neuroma.

conditions.name: Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy
conditions.description: Diabetic neuropathy is nerve damage caused by diabetes. When it affects the arms, hands, legs and feet, it is known as diabetic peripheral neuropathy. Diabetic peripheral neuropathy is different from peripheral arterial disease (poor circulation), which affects the blood vessels rather than the nerves.

conditions.name: Peroneal Tendon Injuries
conditions.description: The two peroneal tendons in the foot run side by side behind the outer ankle bone. The main function of the peroneal tendons is to stabilize the foot and ankle and protect them from sprains.

conditions.name: Plantar Fasciitis
conditions.description: Heel pain is most often caused by plantar fasciitis, a condition that is sometimes also called heel spur syndrome when a spur is present. Heel pain may also be due to other causes, such as a stress fracture, tendonitis, arthritis, nerve irritation or, rarely, a cyst.

conditions.name: Posterior Tibial Tendon Dysfunction (PTTD)
conditions.description: Posterior tibial tendon dysfunction (PTTD) is a condition caused by changes in the tendon, impairing its ability to support the arch. This results in flattening of the foot.

conditions.name: Pre-dislocation Syndrome (Capsulitis)
conditions.description: Capsulitis is a condition in which these ligaments have become inflamed. Although capsulitis can also occur in the joints of the third or fourth toes, it most commonly affects the second toe.

conditions.name: Sesamoid Injuries
conditions.description: Sesamoid injuries can involve the bones, tendons and/or surrounding tissue in the joint. They are often associated with activities requiring increased pressure on the ball of the foot. In addition, people with high arches are at risk for developing sesamoid problems.

conditions.name: Calcaneal Apophysitis (Sever's Disease)
conditions.description: It typically affects children between the ages of 8 and 14 years old, because the heel bone (calcaneus) is not fully developed until at least age 14. When there is too much repetitive stress on the growth plate, inflammation can develop.

conditions.name: Tailor's Bunion
conditions.description: Tailor’s bunion, also called a bunionette, is a prominence of the fifth metatarsal bone at the base of the little toe. The metatarsals are the five long bones of the foot.

conditions.name: Vitamin D Deficiency
conditions.description: In the foot and ankle, stress fractures of the metatarsal bones and ankle may be seen in those with vitamin D deficiency, as well as generalized foot pain.

conditions.name: Plantar Wart (Verruca Plantaris)
conditions.description: A wart is a small growth on the skin that develops when the skin is infected by a virus. Warts can develop anywhere on the foot, but they typically appear on the bottom (plantar side) of the foot. Plantar warts most commonly occur in children, adolescents and the elderly.

homeHero.title: The Kinetic Foot & Ankle Clinic
homeHero.content: Advanced compassionate podiatry solutions in Denver

philosopy.title: Our Philosophy
philosopy.definition: 1. relating to or resulting from motion.
philosopy.description: o (of a work of art) depending on movement for its effect. The human body and specifically the foot are just that: a work of art in motion.  Millenia of evolution have produced a beautiful functional device that can take you anywhere over an entire lifetime.  When its injured, you need a compassionate,skilled craftsman with a specific toolkit designed especially for you and your lifestyle.  Entrust Kinetic Foot and Ankle Clinic to mend, maintain and optimize one of the most important human components. Stay in motion.

form.formTitle: Message Us or to Schedule an Appointment

sections.title: Our Health Mission
sections.description: Our experienced medical professionals are proud to put your healing needs first with care and compassion.

sections.title: Experience
sections.description: With more than 15 years of experience, we assist you in creating a custom recovery plan that's right for you, so that you can get back to what you love faster.

sections.title: A Team Who Cares
sections.description: We strive to help you improve your quality of life and achieve your wellness goals, so you can live your best life possible.
